intro: Dichodon, commonly known as the African daisy, is a genus of flowering plants native to southern Africa. It belongs to the family Asteraceae, which includes daisies, sunflowers, and thistles. Dichodon species are typically shrubs or small trees, characterized by their showy, daisy-like flowers that bloom in clusters. The leaves are usually narrow and often have a slightly hairy texture. These plants are adapted to arid and semi-arid environments, making them resilient to drought conditions.
